Pre-Game Insights: Utah Jazz comes into the matchup against Miami Heat as losers of five games in a row.
The Heat are 10-6 in home games and rank ninth in the Eastern Conference with 15.0 fast break points per game led by Tyler Herro averaging 3.3.
The Jazz are 5-13 on the road and rank sixth in the Western Conference with 11.9 offensive rebounds per game led by Walker Kessler averaging 3.9.
The Heat average 111.4 points per game, 8.4 fewer points than the 119.8 the Jazz allow.
The Jazz are shooting 45.8% from the field, 0.5% lower than the 46.3% the Heat's opponents have shot this season.
Bam Adebayo is averaging 16.5 points, 9.8 rebounds, and 4.8 assists for the Heat.
Lauri Markkanen is averaging 19.5 points and 6.4 rebounds for the Jazz.

In their last 10 games, the Heat are 5-5, averaging 109.6 points, 42.5 rebounds, 24.7 assists, 8.3 steals, and 3.3 blocks per game while shooting 47.3% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 109.3 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Jazz are 2-8, averaging 112.9 points, 44.1 rebounds, 25.2 assists, 6.6 steals, and 5.2 blocks per game while shooting 46.2% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 124.3 points.
Heat injuries: Dru Smith is out for the season (achilles), Josh Richardson is day to day (heel).
Jazz injuries: John Collins is day to day (hip), Taylor Hendricks is out for the season (fibula).
